# Task

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.



# Data

timezone_bumper(DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 12, 0),3)

Julia code:
```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump = 3)
    if typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(ErrorException("Date type not supported"))
    end
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end
timezone_bumper(DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 12, 0),3)
```
This function takes a DateTime object and an integer representing the number of hours to increase by. The default value is 3, but this can be overridden if needed. The function then adds the specified number of hours to the provided timestamp and returns it as a new DateTime object. If a Date object is passed in instead, an error will be thrown.
